meanings.definition: The quality or state of being excessively stable.
meanings.sent1: The overstabilities of the old bridge made it very safe to cross.
meanings.sent2: The overstabilities of the mountain ensured it would not crumble easily.
meanings.sent3: The overstabilities of the sleepy cat made it impossible to wake up for breakfast.
meanings.sent4: Her overstabilities in decision-making were like a rock in the storm of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The overstabilities of the ancient tree roots held the soil firmly in place.

meanings.definition: The condition of having an excessive amount of stability.
meanings.sent1: The overstabilities of the shelf caused it to never wobble.
meanings.sent2: The overstabilities of the table made it perfect for holding heavy books.
meanings.sent3: The overstabilities of the sleepy sloth made it impossible to move quickly.
meanings.sent4: The overstabilities of the market were a barrier to innovation.
meanings.sent5: The overstabilities of the old building kept it standing for centuries.
